Robots in Nature

Human-Robot-Environment Interaction for Advanced Ecosystem Services

...

Aim

To explore the design of robotic systems that can deliver data-driven, precision ecosystem services to help address serious environmental issues & enrich everyday life

Objective

  • Explore interactions between humans, robots, & the environment
  • Develop robotic systems that respond to real-time data from the environment & precisely implement optimized solutions
  • Generate enhanced ecosystem services

Introduction

Recent experiments in robotic construction, earthmoving, & agriculture

Robotic Construction

ETH Zurich, Gramazio & Kohler, Endless Wall, 2011

Source: ETHZ, Gramazio & Kohler

Drone Construction

ETH Zurich, Gramazio & Kohler, Flight Assembled Architecture, 2012

Source: ETHZ, Gramazio & Kohler

Autonomous Earthmoving

Snøhetta, MAX IV Laboratory Landscape, 2016

Source: Snøhetta

Agricultural 3D Printing

Benedikt Groß, Avena+ Test Bed, 2013

Source: Benedikt Groß

Novelty

Using robots to interact with plants and their environment is a novel research direction with great implications for sustainability

Deliverables

  • $500k in developmental grants
  • $7M in large-scale grants
  • Approval for the Robotics graduate program
  • 5+ publications
  • 2+ patents

Eco. Rob. Course Exploratory Workshop Exploratory Workshop Exploratory Workshop Graduate Program

Built Environment Robotics

Algorithmic Garden Pilot

Soft robots that will interactively, algorithmically plant a garden

Robotic Greenwall Pilot

A smart greenwall with a robotic system that waters, delivers nutrients, tends, and re-plants.

Environmental Restoration Robotics

Precision Agricultural Pilot

Controlled tests of aerial planting on agriculture plot

Optimized Wetland Pilot

Aerial planting of mangrove seeds in coastal wetland & autonomous construction of optimized landforms for restoring wetlands

Why?

Because Mangrove restoration is slow, hard work

Source: UNDP

Why?

Because marsh creation is also slow, hard work

Source: USACE

Beyond

  • Establish the LSU Institute for Ecological Robotics to advance robotics research and education
  • Start an Ecological Robotics Design and Consultancy for commercialization
  • Implement a coastal wetland restoration project using ecological robots

Team

Principle Investigators

Brendan Harmon, Landscape Architecture

Hye Yeon Nam, Digital Art

Marcio de Queiroz, Mechanical Engineering

Hunter Gilbert, Mechanical Engineering

Tracy Quirk, Oceanography and Coastal Sciences

Senior Personnel

Clint Willson, Civil and Environmental Engineering

Luciano Shiratsuchi, Precision Agriculture

Niloufar Emami, Architecture

Future Personnel

Corina Barbalata, Mechanical Engineering

Responsibilities

  • Robotic Design: Dr. de Queiroz, Gilbert, Harmon, & Nam
  • Robotic Programming: Dr. de Queiroz, Gilbert, & Harmon
  • Human-Robot Interaction: Dr. Nam & Harmon
  • Digital Fabrication: Dr. Harmon, Nam, & Emami
  • Plant Delivery Systems: Dr. Gilbert & Harmon
  • Planting & Evaluation: Dr. Quirk, Harmon, Willson & Shiratsuchi

Targeted Funding

  • NSF Industry–University Cooperative Research Centers (I/UCRC)
  • NSF National Robotics Initiative 2.0 (NRI)
  • NSF Mind Motor Machine Nexus (M3X)
  • NAS Gulf Research Program (GRP)
  • Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR / STTR)
  • Strategic Environmental Research and Development Program (SERDP)
  • EPA People, Prosperity, and the Planet (P3)

Targeted Partnerships

  • Agencies: USACE Engineering with Nature
  • Drone manufacturers: Parrot, DJI, Sensefly, BirdsEyeView
  • Robot manufacturers: Franka Emika, Automata
  • Other sectors: Oculus, BioCarbon Engineering

Letter of Support

USACE Engineering with Nature

Team Composition

"The team is underpowered in robotics, programming, and engineering expertise."

  • Dr. de Queiroz & Gilbert are robotic engineers
  • Dr. Nam creates artistic robots and writes creative code
  • Dr. Harmon is an active programmer
  • Dr. Willson is a civil & environmental engineer

Team Composition

"The team could benefit from input and interaction with environmental engineers."

  • Dr. Willson has joined the team as senior personnel

Graduate Program Development

"It is not clear if any of the team has been part of the development of a graduate program."

  • Dr. Nam served on the steering committee that developed the Doctor of Design program in 2017
  • Dr. Nam & Harmon serve on the Doctor of Design curriculum committee
  • Dr. Harmon serves on the Master of Landscape Arch. curriculum committee

Administration

"Administrative support is built into the plan however it is not clear how the administrative effort will be used."

  • A dedicated administrator will manage finances, grants, & team coordination

Responsibilities

"It is not clear who from the team would operate, program, and design and implement the proposed research."

  • Robotic Design: Dr. de Queiroz, Gilbert, Harmon, & Nam
  • Robotic Programming: Dr. de Queiroz, Gilbert, & Harmon
  • Human-Robot Interaction: Dr. Nam & Harmon
  • Digital Fabrication: Dr. Harmon & Nam
  • Plant Delivery Systems: Dr. Gilbert & Harmon
  • Planting & Evaluation: Dr. Quirk, Harmon, Willson & Shiratsuchi

Targeted Grants

"Many of their targets, however, are environmental funding agencies but the team does not include environmental engineers."

  • Dr. Harmon brings expertise in landscape ecology & design
  • Dr. Quirk brings expertise in coastal ecology
  • Dr. Willson brings expertise in environmental engineering

Growing the Team

"The proposal is missing a plan to bring collaborators and additional talent into 'the mix' to elevate profile and expand impact."

  • Exploratory workshops will build a network of collaborators

Built Environment Pilot Project

"The scope described in the pilot projects is general and ambitious and lacks important details. It would be important to specify milestones and what exactly will be the novelty and specific outcomes."

"The scope described in the pilot projects is general and ambitious and lacks important details. It would be important to specify milestones and what exactly will be the novelty and specific outcomes."

PhaseTaskOutcomeNovelty
F2021 Aerial surveying Study plot survey
S2022 Aerial planting robot Seed delivery system Unique aerial planting sys.

S2023 Aerial mangrove planting Propagule delivery sys. First mangrove planting robot!
